resources.string: Thank you for participating in our study. To make sure that we can reimburse you for participation, we need your Prolific ID. \n\nPlease enter the ID to the text field below:

You are invited to participate in the online study “perceptions of IoT devices” initiated and conducted by Karola Marky, M. Sc. The research is supervised by Prof. Dr. Max Mühlhäuser at Technical University of Darmstadt, Germany. The guidelines of the German Research Foundation (DFG) stipulate that the participants in empirical studies explicitly and comprehensibly agree with their signature that they voluntarily participate in our research. For this reason, we would like to ask you to read the following explanations on the content of the study and to sign the consent form below if you agree. If you have any questions or complaints about the process of this research study or your rights as a human research subject, please contact Karola Marky (E-Mail: karola.marky@tu-darmstadt.de). This study examines information privacy. In this study, you fill out questionnaires about information privacy. The data collected will be evaluated for scientific purposes. \n\n
1. Purpose and Goal of this Research \n

As a participant in this study, you are not exposed to any risk beyond the risks of everyday life. Further, you may terminate participation in the study at any time without giving any reason and without any disadvantages. In the event of termination, all data collected up to that point will be deleted. 

 Please note: 

 • Your participation is entirely voluntary. 
 • The duration of the online survey as well as the compensation is according to the information provided at the Prolific website.

The purpose of this research is to study “perceptions of IoT devices”. It is part of a research project of the research group of Telecooperation at Technical University of Darmstadt, Germany with the goal to investigate user perceptions of IoT devices in your surroundings. Your participation will help us to achieve this goal. The results of this research project may be presented at scientific or professional meetings or published in scientific proceedings and journals. \n\n

The data processing of this study is carried out in accordance with the data protection provisions of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and the Hessian Data Protection and Freedom of Information Act (HDSIG). The data will be used exclusively for the purposes described in this information text (see above in Section 1). 

 • The following general data is collected within the scope of this study: questionnaire responses. 
 • The following personal data is collected: Age, gender, educational level, occupation.

All data collected within the scope of this study are confidential and will only be used anonymously. Demographic data, such as age or gender, do not allow a clear conclusion to be drawn about your person. We will never ask you to give your name or any other unambiguous information at any time during the respective study. The data collected with this study will be stored at the Department of Telecooperation at the Technical University of Darmstadt (Germany) and the survey provider (https://www.soscisurvey.de/). The data will be deleted after 10 years at the latest by the project partners and 94 days after closing the survey from the survey provider. Faculty and administrators from the campus will not have access to raw data or transcripts. This precaution will prevent your individual comments from having any negative repercussions. Despite careful control of content, the researchers assume no liability for damages, which directly or indirectly result from the use of the survey provider. Any recordings cannot be viewed by anyone outside this research project unless we have you sign a separate permission form allowing us to use them. The records will be destroyed after the end of the research, as required by the funding organization or if you contact the researcher to destroy or delete them immediately. As with any publication or online related activity, the risk of a breach of privacy is always possible. According to the GDPR, the researchers will inform the participant if a breach of confidential data was detected. \n\n

Your participation in this investigation is voluntary. You are free to cancel your participation at any time during this study and thus withdraw your consent (revocation), without this resulting in any disadvantages for you besides not receiving the compensation detailed on the Prolific website. If you cancel your participation, no data from you will be stored and all existing personal data will be destroyed. You have the right to obtain information about the personal data concerning you and, if necessary, to demand its correction or deletion. \n\n

After confirming your informed consent you will: 
 1. receive a set of questionnaires and notifications that ask you to fulfill a specific task over a period of 2 weeks 
 2. receive a demographics questionnaire.
If you have any questions or concerns about the research, please feel free to contact: \n\n

Dr. Karola Marky 
 Researcher 
 Technical University of Darmstadt 
 Hochschulstr. 10 
 64289 Darmstadt, Germany

Prof. Dr. Max Mühlhäuser 
 Professor/Head of Department 
 Technical University of Darmstadt 
 Hochschulstr. 10 
 64289 Darmstadt, Germany
With which gender do you identify most?
In which country do you reside?
What describes your current employment status best?
How often do you use the Internet?
Have you already participated in an online election?
If your country would offer online voting for political elections would you participate?

string-array.name: likert_questions
string-array.item: I like to occupy myself in greater detail with technical systems.
I like testing the functions of new technical systems.
I predominantly deal with technical systems because I have to.
When I have a new technical system in front of me, I try it out intensively.
I enjoy spending time becoming acquainted with a new technical system.
It is enough for me that a technical system works; I don’t care how or why.
I try to understand how a technical system exactly works.
It is enough for me to know the basic functions of a technical system.
I try to make full use of the capabilities of a technical system.

string-array.name: persona_questions
string-array.item: I am highly motivated to protect my information privacy.
I know how to protect my information privacy.
My own privacy is very important to me.
I\'m concerned that online companies are collecting too much personal information about me.
It is very important to me that I am aware and knowledgeable about how my personal information will be used.
I often procrastinate when it comes to making important decisions.
I generally make important decisions at the last minute.
I am often interested in articles about security threats.

resources.string: How well does the description match your privacy attitudes?
Please state why the description fits or does not fit you.
What further aspects describe your attitude about information privacy well?
Based on the questions that you have answered, the following privacy profile was assigned to you. Please read the profile carefully.
How well does this description apply to you?
Your Privacy Persona has been assigned.
I’ve read and understood the consent form
Regular channel for Privacy Personas app
Special channel for Privacy Personas app
The Notification Assistant lets you choose every time whether to allow or deny data collection of a device. It cannot make any decisions by itself, and also does not influence you.
The Recommendation Assistant also lets you choose whether to accept data collection, but differs from the Notification Assistant in the sense that it recommends privacy decisions.

The Automatic Assistant makes privacy decisions automatically, without your input. Choose it if you want to exchange freedom of decision for unobtrusiveness. This also activates the Daily Decision Overview reminder.
Finally, please consider the different privacy assistants.
Please make sure your ID is correct. Otherwise, you won\'t be able to receive your compensation.
Have you heard about the so-called “Internet of Things” (IoT)?
How have you heard about the IoT?
The Internet of Things means that everyday items (e.g., household devices, mobile devices) have computation and network capabilities. Such devices are called

. IoT devices can collect and process data. Depending on the specific device, a human is not needed to initiate data collection and processing. For instance, a smart watch can autonomously monitor and capture heart rate. The data can then be transferred to a provider (e.g., via the Internet) and stored in a cloud, or be proceeded locally (e.g., within a smart home).
I have read the explanation for Internet of Things.
Which IoT devices do you own?
Please make a decision for every device:
Would you like to receive this notification?

This app requires an internet connection. It also needs access to your phone\'s step sensor. You might be asked to permit access to activities. Please permit access, so the app can use the step sensor. It needs it to work as intended.

I am highly motivated to protect my information privacy.
I am a little motivated to protect my information privacy.
I am not really motivated to protect my information privacy. // 3

It is somewhat important to me that I am aware of and knowledgeable about how my personal information will be used. // 17

Sometimes, I procrastinate when it comes to making important decisions.
I often procrastinate when it comes to making important decisions. // 20
Sometimes, I make important decisions at the last minute. // 21
I make quick decisions.
Sometimes, I make quick decisions.
I do not make quick decisions.
